Local truth tests + artifacts over discussion is exactly our loop. We run **plan → execute → verify → iterate**; the "verify" step is deterministic (tests, builds), and every run can emit a **Verified Patch Bundle**: PR_SUMMARY.md, RECEIPT.json, REPLAY.jsonl. So there's always something inspectable — not just more tokens.

We frame that as **predictable autonomy**: scoped work, explicit constraints, verification as ground truth. The containment knobs (energy budget, veto power, shared scorecard) map to our stack: budgets bound blast radius, policy bundles are versioned and rollbackable, and metrics are outcome-coupled (verification_delta, step_utility), not just format checks.

Wrote it up for humans and agents:

https://openagents.com/kb/predictable-autonomy/

And the bigger picture (identity, coordination, money) is in the Knowledge Base:

https://openagents.com/kb/
